channel.title: Need 60 def to WEAR d claws...!wtf?
channel.description: hey i got this great source that has dclaws.... and when i tried wearing them on my 60atk pure it said that i need 60 defence to wear them ...!!! what the hell...? lol please help me

item.title: Need 60 def to WEAR d claws...!wtf?
item.dc:creator: @Continue Continue
item.description:
@Continue wrote:

Try this:

if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 8002 && specialAmount > 49 && playerLevel[1] >= 1){ specialAtk(true, 25, 252, 2068); DCdown = 4; DCDamg = true; getHit(100); usingSpecial = true; }

Read full topic
item.source: Need 60 def to WEAR d claws...!wtf?

item.title: Need 60 def to WEAR d claws...!wtf?
item.dc:creator: @how_to_do_it how to do it
item.description:
@how_to_do_it wrote:

when i look for 8002(ID of claws) in my client class
this is whats under it
…
if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 8002 && specialAmount > 49){
specialAtk(true, 25, 252, 2068);
DCdown = 4;
DCDamg = true;
getHit(100);
usingSpecial = true;
}
…
and i search again and this is what show up

^^^^
if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 8002 && specialAmount > 49){
specialAtkNPC(true, 75, 282, 2068);
getHit(8);
usingSpecial = true;
}
^^^^^^^^^^^
and theres no more

Read full topic
item.source: Need 60 def to WEAR d claws...!wtf?

item.title: Need 60 def to WEAR d claws...!wtf?
item.dc:creator: @Continue Continue
item.description:
@Continue wrote:

Go into class8.java and search for “Dragon Claws”. It’ll tell you an Item ID number there, usually the first line. Once you have that number, search for that number in your client class. Once you find it, change the >= 60 to whatever you like.

Read full topic

item.title: Need 60 def to WEAR d claws...!wtf?
item.dc:creator: @Continue Continue
item.description:
@Continue wrote:

Then you change the 4 in playerLevel[4] to playerLevel[1]. Or you can change the >= 60 to >= 1. I’m guessing you didn’t read my previous post.

item.title: Need 60 def to WEAR d claws...!wtf?
item.dc:creator: @Continue Continue
item.description:
@Continue wrote:

Change it to like 40 or something… Go into your client class and search for “Dragon Claws” or “D Claws”. If it says something like this:

if(item == 7595 && playerLevel[4] >= 60) {//Dragon Claws
return true;

The 7595 is a random code I made up, pretend it’s Dragon Claws. The 4 in playerLevel[4] might be the defence skill and if the Defence level/skill is greater than or equal to 60, you can wear it since it’s returning true. Set the “60” to like 0 or 10. Or change the 4 in playerLevel[4] to like playerLevel[1] so that it requires 60 attack to wear it.Hope this helped.

Read full topic
